alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Central and southern Greenville County, South Carolina, including the Greenville metropolitan area. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to drainages and streams including parks and greenways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 453 PM EDT, Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rainfall have fallen since early this morning across central and southern Greenville County, including the city of Greenville. This is causing gradual excessive runoff into area drainages and streams, including the Reedy River and West Brushy Creek in Berea and Greenville; East Brushy Creek, Gilder Creek, and the Enoree River near Mauldin, Five Forks, Taylors, and Greer; and Grove Creek near Welcome and Piedmont. Generally, this runoff has not been enough to cause drainages and streams to exceed their banks. However, additional rainfall up to 1 inch is possible over the next few hours as another round of rainfall moves over Greenville County. This rainfall will exacerbate ongoing runoff and cause nuisance flooding along isolated reaches of area drainages and streams through this evening, including the Reedy River from Berea to Cleveland Park. - The Reedy River at Hudson St is approaching 8 feet and is rising steadily. This will cause nuisance, shallow flooding of isolated areas of the Swamp Rabbit Trail at Unity Park and Cleveland Park. Another round of heavy rainfall is possible later tonight, generally after 10pm. Given wet soils and elevated streams from ongoing rainfall, any additional heavy rainfall, especially over a short period of time, may induce flash flooding over the area. Please stay weather aware tonight in case new Advisories or Warnings are issued. - Some locations that may experience nuisance flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Unity Park, Reedy Falls Park, Cleveland Park, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Berea, Five Forks, Fountain Inn, Welcome, Powdersville, and Piedmont
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
